glsa.title: unp: Arbitrary command execution
glsa.synopsis: unp allows execution of arbitrary code via malicious file names.

background.p: unp is a script for unpacking various file formats.

description.p: Erich Schubert from Debian discovered that unp does not escape file names properly before passing them to calls of the shell.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to unpack a compressed archive with a specially crafted file name, leading to the execution of shell commands from within the filename. That code will be executed with the privileges of the user running unp.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
